channel.title: OpenClover Blog
channel.description: OpenClover code coverage tool for Java, Groovy and AspectJ

item.title: OpenClover road map - look into the future
item.description: What next can you expect to see in OpenClover? We'd like to share our plans.

channel.description: OpenClover code coverage tool for Java, Groovy and AspectJ

item.title: OpenClover 4.5.0 is available!
item.description: New feature release with support for Java 17 and annotations on data types.

item.title: OpenClover 4.4.1 is available!
item.description: In case you struggled to use OpenClover 4.4.0, this bug-fix release brings three major fixes.

item.title: OpenClover 4.4.0 is available!
item.description: We are thrilled to share with you new feature release 4.4.0.

item.title: OpenClover 4.3.1 is available!
item.description: Release 4.3.1 fixes a blocker introduced in 4.3.0, which was causing parse errors during code instrumentation.

item.title: Let's meet in Barcelona!
item.description: I'll be on the Atlassian Summit conference in Barcelona.

item.title: OpenClover 4.3.0 is available!
item.description: We are proud to share with you new feature release of OpenClover. Version 4.3.0 brings support for Java 9.

item.title: OpenClover platform deprecation announcements
item.description: As we want to modernize and simplify code base as well as simplify testing, we would like to drop support for some of the old tools.

item.title: Jenkins Clover Plugin 4.9.0 has been released
item.description: In this release we focused on solving bugs related with Pipeline builds and remote agents.

item.title: Autumn update
item.description: We are happy to announce that we have prepared end-user and developer documentation on our website.

item.title: OpenClover 4.2.0 has been released. What's next?
item.description: We are happy to announce that our first release of OpenClover is out. It is based on the open-sourced code of Atlassian Clover 4.1.2.

item.title: Welcome to OpenClover
item.description: In April 2017 AtlassianÂ® decided to publish sources of Clover - the most sophisticated code coverage tool for Java and Groovy.
